content.title: Back in the civilian ranks and looking to lead
content.content: Outreach program teaches veterans how to apply lessons learned on-duty.

content.title: Retiring Hart School faculty impact JMU students in perpetuity
content.content: Hart School Professors Neil Marrin and Tassie Pippert (’11, ’13 M.Ed.) create a scholarship to support study abroad and experiential learning opportunities for JMU Hart School students.

content.title: “Power” Dukes lead the way in commerce
content.content: James Madison University is well represented in the Virginia Business 2022 Power List of the 500 most influential Virginians. A dozen Dukes made the magazine’s Virginia 500, which profiles executives across 20 sectors of the commonwealth’s economy.

content.title: Halftime on the Quad
content.content: It’s officially fall! As we prepare for a fun and busy season, including Family Weekend this coming weekend and fall break right around the corner, we want to take a moment to reflect on how far you’ve already come. You’ve made it halfway through the semester!

content.title: JMU professors propose new program for students on the autism spectrum
content.content: Zachary Bortolot, director and professor of JMU’s Geography Program, and Laura Desportes, professor of education, team up to create a Comprehensive Transition Postsecondary (CTP) program for individuals on the autism spectrum.
